result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard D. Ohara

defendant.name: Ohara, Richard D.
defendant.address: 1876 Ford Parkway, Unit 1, Saint Paul, MN 55116

records.addlTxt: Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. Def pleas NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:51 pm.

2:35 PM Richard D. Ohara appears in Court,  Atty Derek W Sanders, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer for State of Wisconsin. Inv. Christopher Stewart. S/T. ADA Schieffer questions Inv. Stewart. Record reflects identification of DE. Atty Sanders has no questions. ADA Schieffer is asking the Court find probable cause and bind DE over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the Defendant probably committed a felony. Court binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Status conference scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on December 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
filed by ADA Joseph Schieffer. eif

3:22 PM  Assistant District Attorney Kaley Walker in Court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard D. Ohara appears via videoconferencing from PCJ.  Attorney Liesl Nelson in Court for Atty. Derek W Sanders.  Court questions nonappearance.  Atty. Nelson notes Defendant had issues getting to court and didn't appear regarding stayed warrant.  Court quashes warrant and reinstates bond.  Court confirms Defendant's address and phone, phone updated.  Adjourned at 3:26 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Extradite Adj. States          JRG signed 9/27/22 - E: DA, Atty & Email: Jail & Dispatch. eif

3:10 PM Richard D. Ohara does not appear in Court,  Atty Derek Sanders, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Sanders has no information. Due to non-appearance DA Halle Hatch is requesting the stay be lifted and warrant issued adj. States. Court will authorize warrant adj. States. Court adjourned at 3:11 pm.

2:37 PM Richard D. Ohara does not appears in Court,  Atty Derek W Sanders, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Sanders: spoke to DE today re: transportation.  ADA Schieffer is requesting a warrant but asking it to be stayed until next Tuesday. Court will authorize warrant and stay until 9/26/22. Court adjourned at 2:39 pm.
Return on warrant scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Return on warrant on September 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
NO CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH ST. CROIX STORAGE AT 900 WASSON LANE RIVER FALLS, WI.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
3:01 PM Richard D. Ohara appears in custody from Jail via zoom,  Atty Travis Satorius, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions non-appearance, he never received the summons. Court will quash the warrant. Victim appears by phone. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $ 5,000 00  w/conditions of no contact w/St. Croix Storage at 900 Wasson Lane River Falls, no objection. Court so orders. Waive time limits.  Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:14 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
